title: Drawing, "View of Night-blooming cereus Growing Gut of a Duck-ant's Nest on a Tree Trunk, Jamaica", May–August 1865
markings: Verso: Stamped in ink, at center: Lugt 457d.
inscribed: Verso:  Inscribed in graphite, at center: Variety of Night-blooming cereus, growing out of a duck-ant's nest.
description: Vertical rectangle with two parastical plants growing from a gnarled protrusion on a tree trunk, possibly a night-blooming cereus growing out of a duck-ant's nest.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "View of Night-blooming cereus Growing Gut of a Duck-ant's Nest on a Tree Trunk, Jamaica", May–August 1865.
May–August 1865. Graphite on white paper. Gift of Louis P. Church. 1917-4-607-b.
